* Represents a task with a deadline. A <code>DeadlineTask<code> object has a
* <code>description<code> String toBeCompletedBy that is the time that the task must be completed by.
* @param toBeCompletedBy the time that the task must be completed by
* Represents an event task. A <code>EventTask<code> object has
* a <code>description<code> String startTime that is the time that the event starts and
* a <code>description<code> String endTime that is the time that the event ends
* @param startTime time that the task starts
* @param endTime time that the task ends
public EventTask(String description, String startTime, String endTime) {
* Represents a task. A <code>Task<code> object has
* a <code>description<code> String member that is the name of the task
* a <code>isDone<code> boolean member that represents whether the task is completed or not
* boolean isDone is set to false by default
* because we assume the task is not completed at the time of adding to the list
* Even if the task is already done, this method will not throw an exception
* Even if the task is not yet done, this method will not throw an exception
* Represents a task without a start date or a deadline.
* Represents a list that serves as the database for the tasks.
* Prints responses in response to commands as well.
* Index starts from O, but will be printed as starting from 1 in showList().
* Creates a new ToDoTask and adds it to the toDoList.
* Prints message to inform user that task has been added.
+ "I have added the following ToDo to your list: "+ description + "\n"

+ "I have added the following Deadline to your list: "+ description + "\n"

* Prints the index and string representation of every task in the toDoList.
* Index starts from 0 in ArrayList, but will be printed out as starting from 1.
* Marks tasks in the list as done.
* If the task does not exist, informs user that the task does not exist.
* @param index the index of the task in the ArrayList toDoList
System.out.println("Well done, I have marked " + task + " as done.");
System.out.println("I do not have this task in my list.");
* Marks tasks in the list as done.
* If the task does not exist, informs user that the task does not exist.
* @param index the index of the task in the ArrayList toDoList
System.out.println("Understood, I have unmarked " + task + " as done.");
System.out.println("I do not have this task in my list.");
* Delete a task in the list.
* If the task does not exist, informs user that the task does not exist.
* @param index the index of the task in the ArrayList toDoList
System.out.println("Very well, I have deleted " + task + " .");
System.out.println("I do not have this task in my list.");
